teamstoolkit.accountTree.azureAccountToo:
AZURE ACCOUNT  
The Teams Toolkit may require an Azure subscription to deploy the Azure resources for your project.
teamstoolkit.accountTree.m365AccountTool:
Microsoft 365 ACCOUNT  
The Teams Toolkit requires an Microsoft 365 organizational account where Teams is running and has been registered.
teamstoolkit.accountTree.noSubscriptions: You have no subscriptions. You can't provision or deploy your resources to Azure!
teamstoolkit.accountTree.sideloadingMess: [Sideloading](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/concepts/build-and-test/prepare-your-o365-tenant#enable-custom-teams-apps-and-turn-on-custom-app-uploading) is disabled in your Microsoft 365 account. Contact your Teams administrator to resolve this issue or get a testing tenant.
teamstoolkit.accountTree.sideloadingPass: You have sideloading permission already. You're good to install your app to Teams!
teamstoolkit.accountTree.sideloadingStat: The sideloading permission of this account is unknown due to network or service issue. Please refresh again later to check it.
teamstoolkit.accountTree.sideloadingWarn:
Microsoft 365 account admin doesn't have enabled sideloading permission.
· Contact your Teams administrator to resolve this issue. Visit: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/m365-apps/prerequisites
· Follow our Account Help guidance to create a free testing tenant. The guidance can be found by clicking "Sideloading disabled" label under your account.
teamstoolkit.appStudioLogin.loginCancel:
Sign in canceled. The Teams Toolkit requires a Microsoft 365 (organizational account) with sideloading option.
If your account is not ready, create a free Microsoft 365 testing tenant to start your Teams App development.
teamstoolkit.appStudioLogin.message: The Teams Toolkit requires a Microsoft 365 organizational account where Teams is running and has been registered. You can create a free testing account from Microsoft 365 Developer Program if needed.
teamstoolkit.azureLogin.message: The Teams Toolkit requires an Azure account and subscription to deploy the Azure resources for your project. You will not be charged without further confirmation.
teamstoolkit.azureLogin.unknownSubscript: Cannot set subscription. Select a subscription that you have access to.

teamstoolkit.guides.addAzureAPIM.detail: An API gateway can be used to administer APIs created for Teams applications and publish them to consume on other applications, such as Power apps.

teamstoolkit.guides.addAzureFunction.det: A serverless solution to create web APIs for your Teams applications backend.
teamstoolkit.guides.addAzureKeyVault.det: Safeguard cryptographic keys and other secrets used by Teams application.
teamstoolkit.guides.addAzureSql.detail: A platform as a service (PaaS) database engine to serve as your Teams applications data store.
teamstoolkit.guides.addAzureSql.label: Integrate with Azure SQL Database
teamstoolkit.guides.addBot.detail: A chat bot or conversational bot that runs simple and repetitive tasks by users.
teamstoolkit.guides.addBot.label: Configure Bot Capability
teamstoolkit.guides.addME.detail: Allow the users to interact with your web service through buttons and forms.
teamstoolkit.guides.addME.label: Configure Messaging Extension Capability
teamstoolkit.guides.addOutlookAddin.deta: Outlook add-ins are web apps that extend the functionality of Outlook.

teamstoolkit.guides.addTab.detail: Teams-aware web pages embedded in Microsoft Teams.
teamstoolkit.guides.addTab.label: Configure Tab Capability
teamstoolkit.guides.cardActionResponse.d: Automate repetitive workflows for common business processes in conversation

teamstoolkit.guides.cicdPipeline.label: Automate CI/CD Pipelines
teamstoolkit.guides.commandAndResponse.d: Automate repetitive tasks with a simple command and response in conversation.

teamstoolkit.guides.connectApi.detail: Connect to an API with authentication support using TeamsFx SDK.
teamstoolkit.guides.connectApi.label: Connect to an API

teamstoolkit.guides.dashboardApp.label: Embed a Dashboard Canvas in Teams
teamstoolkit.guides.sendNotification.det: Send notifications to Teams from your web services with Bot or incoming webhook.

teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.command.pre:
Validate prerequisites.
 See https://aka.ms/teamsfx-tasks/check-prerequisites for details and how to customize the arguments.
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.command.sta:
Start the local tunneling service.
 See https://aka.ms/teamsfx-tasks/local-tunnel for details and how to customize the arguments.
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.command.pro:
Execute provision lifecycle.
 See https://aka.ms/teamsfx-tasks/provision for details and how to customize the arguments.
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.command.dep:
Execute deploy lifecycle.
 See https://aka.ms/teamsfx-tasks/deploy for details and how to customize the arguments.
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.command.lau:
Launch Teams web client. 
 See https://aka.ms/teamsfx-tasks/launch-web-client for details and how to customize the arguments.
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.args.prereq: Prompt to sign-in for Microsoft 365 account and validate if the account has side-loading permission enabled.
Check ports availability for debug use.
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.args.ngrokA: The arguments passed to the ngrok install command.
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.args.ngrokP:
The ngrok path.
If undefined, use Teams Toolkit ngrok, otherwise use provided ngrok.
e.g."ngrokPath": "ngrok" | "C:/sample/path/ngrok" | "./bot/node_modules/ngrok/bin/ngrok"
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.args.tunnel:
Tunnel inspection.
If undefined, get endpoint from log first, then the first PublicURL from default inspection "http://127.0.0.1:4040/api/tunnels"
Otherwise, use provided inspection (the first PublicURL).
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.args.output: The keys of the environment variables of tunnel domain and tunnel endpoint.
The key of the environment variable for tunnel domain.
The key of the environment variable for tunnel endpoint.
The key of the environment variable for dev tunnel id.
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.args.type.t: The type of the local tunneling service.
teamstoolkit.manageCollaborator.grantPer: Add owners to your Teams app and Azure Active Director app registrations so they can make changes
teamstoolkit.manageCollaborator.listColl: List all the owners who can make changes to your Teams and Azure Active Director app registrations
teamstoolkit.manageCollaborator.command: Manage who can make changes to your app
teamstoolkit.viewsWelcome.teamsfx-empty-:
Jump right into Teams Toolkit and get an overview of the fundamentals. For more information, visit [Get Started](command:fx-extension.openWelcome?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D).
Walk through the steps to build a real-world Teams app.
[Documentation](command:fx-extension.openDocument?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D)
[How-to Guides](command:fx-extension.selectTutorials?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D)
Create a project or explore our samples.
[Create a New App](command:fx-extension.create?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D)
[View Samples](command:fx-extension.openSamples?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D)
You need to upgrade the project to the new configuration files to use the latest features. The upgrade process will not change your custom code. It will create the backup files in case you want to roll back.
This upgrade is mandatory to continue using the current version of Teams Toolkit. If you don't want to upgrade now, please keep using Teams Toolkit version <=2.10.0.
[Upgrade Project](command:fx-extension.checkProjectUpgrade?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D)
_teamstoolkit.viewsWelcome.teamsfx-empty: For command like [Get Started](command:xxx), please translate 'Get Started' and keep the string 'command:xxx'
teamstoolkit.viewsWelcome.teamsfx-projec:
[Upgrade Project](command:fx-extension.checkProjectUpgrade?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D)
Upgrade your Teams Toolkit project to stay compatible with the latest version. A backup directory will be created along with an Upgrade Summary. [More Info](command:fx-extension.openDocument?%5B%22SideBar%22%2C%22learnmore%22%5D)
If you don't want to upgrade now, please keep using Teams Toolkit version 4.x.x.

Take 2 minutes to help us improve, your feedback matters!
[We Would Love Your Feedback](command:fx-extension.openSurvey)
teamstoolkit.walkthroughs.description: Jumpstart your Teams app development experience
teamstoolkit.walkthroughs.steps.teamsToo:
Start with [Teams](https://aka.ms/teamsfx-capabilities-overview) or [Outlook add-in](https://aka.ms/teamsfx-outlook-add-in-capabilities) capability to build your first app.
You can create it from the scratch or explore our samples to help you quickly get started with the real-world examples and code structures.
[Create a New App](command:fx-extension.createFromWalkthrough?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D)
[View Samples](command:fx-extension.openSamples?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D)

Create a free Microsoft 365 testing tenant to install and preview your Teams apps in Teams.
 If you already have a Microsoft 365 organizational account, [Sign in to Microsoft 365](command:fx-extension.signinM365?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D) and validate [sideloading](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/concepts/build-and-test/prepare-your-o365-tenant#enable-custom-teams-apps-and-turn-on-custom-app-uploading) is enabled.
[Create a Microsoft 365 Testing Tenant](https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/dev-program)
Create a Microsoft 365 testing tenant for free

You can provision resources in the cloud and deploy your app's code to the provisioned resources. Finally, distribute your first app to Teams.
[Open Lifecycle Commands](command:fx-extension.openLifecycleTreeview?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D)
__Tip: Learn more about ['Lifecycle'](https://aka.ms/teamsfx-provision).__

Developing Teams application with JavaScript or TypeScript requires NPM and Node.js. Check your environment and get ready for your first Teams app development.
[Run Prerequisite Checker](command:fx-extension.validate-getStarted-prerequisites?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D)

Here are some recommendations to continue your journey with Teams Toolkit.
 • Explore [How-to Guides](command:fx-extension.selectTutorials?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D) and get more practical guidances
 • Open [Readme.md](command:fx-extension.openReadMe?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D) to understand how to develop this app
 • Read our [Documentation](command:fx-extension.openDocument?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D)

Press [F5](command:fx-extension.selectAndDebug?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D) or discover '[Run and Debug](command:workbench.view.debug)' panel on the activity bar, and click the play icon to locally preview your app in Teams context.
[Run Local Preview (F5)](command:fx-extension.selectAndDebug?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D)
__Tip: To run local preview, sign in to Microsoft 365 (organizational account) with sideloading option.__
teamstoolkit.walkthroughs.title: Get Started with Teams Toolkit
